function.name: to_tm
function.purpose: Converts a date to a tm struct. Throws out_of_range exception if date is a special value.

function.name: date_from_tm
function.purpose: Converts a tm structure into a date dropping the any time values.

function.name: to_simple_string
function.purpose: To YYYY-mmm-DD string where mmm 3 char month name. Example: 2002-Jan-01.

function.name: to_simple_string
function.purpose: Convert date period to simple string. Example: [2002-Jan-01/2002-Jan-02].

function.name: to_iso_string
function.purpose: Date period to iso standard format CCYYMMDD/CCYYMMDD. Example: 20021225/20021231.

function.name: to_iso_extended_string
function.purpose: Convert to iso extended format string CCYY-MM-DD. Example 2002-12-31.

function.name: to_iso_string
function.purpose: Convert to iso standard string YYYYMMDD. Example: 20021231.

function.name: to_simple_wstring
function.purpose: Convert date period to simple string. Example: [2002-Jan-01/2002-Jan-02].

function.name: to_simple_wstring
function.purpose: To YYYY-mmm-DD string where mmm 3 char month name. Example: 2002-Jan-01.

function.name: to_iso_wstring
function.purpose: Date period to iso standard format CCYYMMDD/CCYYMMDD. Example: 20021225/20021231.

function.name: to_iso_extended_wstring
function.purpose: Convert to iso extended format string CCYY-MM-DD. Example 2002-12-31.

function.name: to_iso_wstring
function.purpose: Convert to iso standard string YYYYMMDD. Example: 20021231.

class.name: gregorian_calendar
class.purpose: Gregorian calendar for this implementation, hard work in the base.

typedef.name: day_of_week_type
typedef.purpose: Type to hold a weekday (eg: Sunday, Monday,...)

typedef.name: day_of_year_type
typedef.purpose: Counter type from 1 to 366 for gregorian dates.

typedef.name: date_rep_type
typedef.purpose: Internal date representation that handles infinity, not a date.

typedef.name: date_traits_type
typedef.purpose: Date rep implements the traits stuff as well.

typedef.name: fancy_date_rep
typedef.purpose: An internal date representation that includes infinities, not a date.

class.name: date
class.purpose: A date type based on gregorian_calendar.

description.para: This class is the primary interface for programming with greogorian dates. The is a lightweight type that can be freely passed by value. All comparison operators are supported.

method.name: julian_day
method.purpose: Return the Julian Day number for the date.

method.name: day_of_year
method.purpose: Return the day of year 1..365 or 1..366 (for leap year)

method.name: modjulian_day
method.purpose: Return the Modified Julian Day number for the date.

method.name: day_number
method.purpose: Return the day number from the calendar.

method.name: end_of_month
method.purpose: Return the last day of the current month.

constructor.purpose: Main constructor with year, month, day.
Constructor for infinities, not a date, max and min date.

struct.name: bad_day_of_month
struct.purpose: Exception type for gregorian day of month (1..31)

constructor.purpose: Allow other classes to throw with unique string for bad day like Feb 29.

class.name: greg_day
class.purpose: Represent a day of the month (range 1 - 31)

description.para: This small class allows for simple conversion an integer value into a day of the month for a standard gregorian calendar. The type is automatically range checked so values outside of the range 1-31 will cause a bad_day_of_month exception

typedef.name: greg_day_policies
typedef.purpose: Policy class that declares error handling and day of month ranges.

typedef.name: greg_day_rep
typedef.purpose: Generated represetation for gregorian day of month.

struct.name: bad_day_of_year
struct.purpose: Exception type for day of year (1..366)

typedef.name: greg_day_of_year_policies
typedef.purpose: A day of the year range (1..366)

typedef.name: greg_day_of_year_rep
typedef.purpose: Define a range representation type for the day of the year 1..366.

class.name: date_duration
class.purpose: Durations in days for gregorian system.

method.name: operator-=
method.purpose: Subtract another duration -- result is signed.

method.name: operator+=
method.purpose: Add a duration -- result is signed.

method.name: operator/=
method.purpose: Division operations on a duration with an integer.

method.name: unit
method.purpose: Returns the smallest duration -- used by to calculate 'end'.

typedef.name: date_duration_rep
typedef.purpose: An internal date representation that includes infinities, not a date.

typedef.name: days
typedef.purpose: Shorthand for date_duration.

struct.name: greg_durations_config
struct.purpose: config struct for additional duration types (ie months_duration<> & years_duration<>)

struct.name: greg_facet_config
struct.purpose: Configuration of the output facet template.

typedef.name: greg_base_facet
typedef.purpose: Create the base facet type for gregorian::date.

function.name: operator<<
function.purpose: ostream operator for gregorian::date

description.para:
Uses the date facet to determine various output parameters including:
string values for the month (eg: Jan, Feb, Mar) (default: English)
string values for special values (eg: not-a-date-time) (default: English)
selection of long, short strings, or numerical month representation (default: short string)
month day year order (default yyyy-mmm-dd)

function.name: operator<<
function.purpose: operator<< for gregorian::greg_month typically streaming: Jan, Feb, Mar...

description.para: Uses the date facet to determine output string as well as selection of long or short strings. Default if no facet is installed is to output a 2 wide numeric value for the month eg: 01 == Jan, 02 == Feb, ... 12 == Dec.

function.name: operator<<
function.purpose: operator<< for gregorian::greg_weekday typically streaming: Sun, Mon, Tue, ...

description.para: Uses the date facet to determine output string as well as selection of long or short string. Default if no facet is installed is to output a 3 char english string for the day of the week.

function.name: operator<<
function.purpose: operator<< for gregorian::date_period typical output: [2002-Jan-01/2002-Jan-31]

description.para: Uses the date facet to determine output string as well as selection of long or short string fr dates. Default if no facet is installed is to output a 3 char english string for the day of the week.

function.name: operator<<
function.purpose: operator<< for gregorian::partial_date. Output: "Jan 1"

function.name: operator<<
function.purpose: operator<< for gregorian::nth_kday_of_month. Output: "first Mon of Jun"

function.name: operator<<
function.purpose: operator<< for gregorian::first_kday_of_month. Output: "first Mon of Jun"

function.name: operator<<
function.purpose: operator<< for gregorian::last_kday_of_month. Output: "last Mon of Jun"

function.name: operator<<
function.purpose: operator<< for gregorian::first_kday_after. Output: "first Mon after"

function.name: operator<<
function.purpose: operator<< for gregorian::first_kday_before. Output: "first Mon before"

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: operator>> for gregorian::date

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: operator>> for gregorian::date_duration

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: operator>> for gregorian::date_period

function.name: generate_locale
function.purpose: generates a locale with the set of gregorian name-strings of type char*

function.name: create_facet_def
function.purpose: Returns a pointer to a facet with a default set of names (English)

function.name: generate_locale
function.purpose: generates a locale with the set of gregorian name-strings of type wchar_t*

function.name: create_facet_def
function.purpose: Returns a pointer to a facet with a default set of names (English)

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: operator>> for gregorian::greg_month - throws exception if invalid month given

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: operator>> for gregorian::greg_weekday - throws exception if invalid weekday given

struct.name: bad_month
struct.purpose: Exception thrown if a greg_month is constructed with a value out of range.

class.name: greg_month
class.purpose: Wrapper class to represent months in gregorian based calendar.

method.name: conversion-operator
method.purpose: Convert the value back to a short.

method.name: as_number
method.purpose: Returns month as number from 1 to 12.

constructor.purpose: Construct a month from the months_of_year enumeration.

method.name: get_month_map_ptr
method.purpose: Shared pointer to a map of Month strings (Names & Abbrev) & numbers.

typedef.name: greg_month_policies
typedef.purpose: Build a policy class for the greg_month_rep.

typedef.name: greg_month_rep
typedef.purpose: A constrained range that implements the gregorian_month rules.

description.para: Method that does serialization for gregorian::date -- splits to load/save
Function to save gregorian::date objects using serialization lib
Dates are serialized into a string for transport and storage. While it would be more efficient to store the internal integer used to manipulate the dates, it is an unstable solution.
Function to load gregorian::date objects using serialization lib
Dates are serialized into a string for transport and storage. While it would be more efficient to store the internal integer used to manipulate the dates, it is an unstable solution.
override needed b/c no default constructor
Function to save gregorian::date_duration objects using serialization lib
Function to load gregorian::date_duration objects using serialization lib
override needed b/c no default constructor
helper unction to save date_duration objects using serialization lib
helper function to load date_duration objects using serialization lib
override needed b/c no default constructor
Function to save gregorian::date_period objects using serialization lib
date_period objects are broken down into 2 parts for serialization: the begining date object and the end date object
Function to load gregorian::date_period objects using serialization lib
date_period objects are broken down into 2 parts for serialization: the begining date object and the end date object
override needed b/c no default constructor
Function to save gregorian::greg_year objects using serialization lib
Function to load gregorian::greg_year objects using serialization lib
override needed b/c no default constructor
Function to save gregorian::greg_month objects using serialization lib
Function to load gregorian::greg_month objects using serialization lib
override needed b/c no default constructor
Function to save gregorian::greg_day objects using serialization lib
Function to load gregorian::greg_day objects using serialization lib
override needed b/c no default constructor
Function to save gregorian::greg_weekday objects using serialization lib
Function to load gregorian::greg_weekday objects using serialization lib
override needed b/c no default constructor
Function to save gregorian::partial_date objects using serialization lib
partial_date objects are broken down into 2 parts for serialization: the day (typically greg_day) and month (typically greg_month) objects
Function to load gregorian::partial_date objects using serialization lib
partial_date objects are broken down into 2 parts for serialization: the day (greg_day) and month (greg_month) objects
override needed b/c no default constructor
Function to save nth_day_of_the_week_in_month objects using serialization lib
nth_day_of_the_week_in_month objects are broken down into 3 parts for serialization: the week number, the day of the week, and the month
Function to load nth_day_of_the_week_in_month objects using serialization lib
nth_day_of_the_week_in_month objects are broken down into 3 parts for serialization: the week number, the day of the week, and the month
override needed b/c no default constructor
Function to save first_day_of_the_week_in_month objects using serialization lib
first_day_of_the_week_in_month objects are broken down into 2 parts for serialization: the day of the week, and the month
Function to load first_day_of_the_week_in_month objects using serialization lib
first_day_of_the_week_in_month objects are broken down into 2 parts for serialization: the day of the week, and the month
override needed b/c no default constructor
Function to save last_day_of_the_week_in_month objects using serialization lib
last_day_of_the_week_in_month objects are broken down into 2 parts for serialization: the day of the week, and the month
Function to load last_day_of_the_week_in_month objects using serialization lib
last_day_of_the_week_in_month objects are broken down into 2 parts for serialization: the day of the week, and the month
override needed b/c no default constructor
Function to save first_day_of_the_week_before objects using serialization lib
Function to load first_day_of_the_week_before objects using serialization lib
override needed b/c no default constructor
Function to save first_day_of_the_week_after objects using serialization lib
Function to load first_day_of_the_week_after objects using serialization lib
override needed b/c no default constructor

struct.name: bad_weekday
struct.purpose: Exception that flags that a weekday number is incorrect.

class.name: greg_weekday
class.purpose: Represent a day within a week (range 0==Sun to 6==Sat)

class.name: greg_year
class.purpose: Represent a day of the month (range 1900 - 10000)

description.para: This small class allows for simple conversion an integer value into a year for the gregorian calendar. This currently only allows a range of 1900 to 10000. Both ends of the range are a bit arbitrary at the moment, but they are the limits of current testing of the library. As such they may be increased in the future.

typedef.name: greg_year_policies
typedef.purpose: Policy class that declares error handling gregorian year type.

typedef.name: greg_year_rep
typedef.purpose: Generated representation for gregorian year.

header.name: boost/date_time/gregorian/gregorian.hpp
header.para: Single file header that provides overall include for all elements of the gregorian date-time system. This includes the various types defined, but also other functions for formatting and parsing.

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: input operator for date

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: input operator for date_duration

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: input operator for date_period

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: input operator for greg_month

function.purpose: input operator for greg_weekday

function.purpose: input operator for greg_day

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: input operator for greg_year

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: input operator for partial_date

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: input operator for nth_day_of_the_week_in_month

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: input operator for first_day_of_the_week_in_month

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: input operator for last_day_of_the_week_in_month

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: input operator for first_day_of_the_week_after

function.name: operator>>
function.purpose: input operator for first_day_of_the_week_before

header.name: boost/date_time/gregorian/gregorian_types.hpp
header.para: Single file header that defines most of the types for the gregorian date-time system.

typedef.name: date_period
typedef.purpose: Date periods for the gregorian system.

typedef.name: year_based_generator
typedef.purpose: A unifying date_generator base type.

description.para: A unifying date_generator base type for: partial_date, nth_day_of_the_week_in_month, first_day_of_the_week_in_month, and last_day_of_the_week_in_month

typedef.name: partial_date
typedef.purpose: A date generation object type.

typedef.name: day_clock
typedef.purpose: A clock to get the current day from the local computer.

typedef.name: date_iterator
typedef.purpose: Base date_iterator type for gregorian types.

typedef.name: day_iterator
typedef.purpose: A day level iterator.

typedef.name: week_iterator
typedef.purpose: A week level iterator.

typedef.name: month_iterator
typedef.purpose: A month level iterator.

typedef.name: year_iterator
typedef.purpose: A year level iterator.

function.name: special_value_from_string
function.purpose: Return special_value from string argument.

description.para: Return special_value from string argument. If argument is not one of the special value names (defined in src/gregorian/names.hpp), return 'not_special'

function.name: from_string
function.purpose: Deprecated: Use from_simple_string.

function.name: from_simple_string
function.purpose: From delimited date string where with order year-month-day eg: 2002-1-25 or 2003-Jan-25 (full month name is also accepted)

function.name: from_us_string
function.purpose: From delimited date string where with order year-month-day eg: 1-25-2003 or Jan-25-2003 (full month name is also accepted)

function.name: from_uk_string
function.purpose: From delimited date string where with order day-month-year eg: 25-1-2002 or 25-Jan-2003 (full month name is also accepted)

function.name: from_undelimited_string
function.purpose: From iso type date string where with order year-month-day eg: 20020125.

function.name: date_from_iso_string
function.purpose: From iso type date string where with order year-month-day eg: 20020125.

function.name: from_stream
function.purpose: Stream should hold a date in the form of: 2002-1-25. Month number, abbrev, or name are accepted.

function.name: date_period_from_string
function.purpose: Function to parse a date_period from a string (eg: [2003-Oct-31/2003-Dec-25])

function.name: date_period_from_wstring
function.purpose: Function to parse a date_period from a wstring (eg: [2003-Oct-31/2003-Dec-25])
